article_title: Mark-Viverito Elected Speaker of New York City Council
article_text:
The City Council elected Melissa Mark-Viverito on Wednesday as speaker, installing a top ally of Mayor Bill de Blasio in the second-most-powerful position in New York City government.

Ms. Mark-Viverito, a council member from East Harlem who was born in Puerto Rico, is the first Latina to lead the 51-member municipal legislature. She succeeds Christine Quinn, who held the council's top spot since 2006 and stepped down last month after...
